result.execSummary:
The defendant Lindsay L. Hodges was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lindsay L. Hodges

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Voucher, Affidavit Regarding Fees and Expenses and Order for Payment and Statement

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Lindsay L. Hodges in court, in custody with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 9:14 am. State gives plea agreement, plea to ct 1 withheld sentence 4 years probation and ct's 2, 3 & 4 DRI, costs only. No Credit. Atty Laufenberg agrees with credit.  Atty Laufenberg and def. agree with plea agreement. Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed.  Def. understands charge and penalties.  State explain charge.  Ct 1 Poss w/intent amphetamine, repeater, Guilty plea.  Ct's 2, 3, & 4 DRI.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Def. understands elements.  Atty Laufenberg is satisfied.  Court finds plea is freely & voluntarily given. Factual basis stipulated.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and finds def. Guilty to Ct. 1 Poss w/intent amphetamine, repeater.  Def. admits prior convictions. Everything Judge previously said, stands.  State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Laufenberg gives sentencing recommendations. Def. makes statement.  Court orders on Ct. 1 - withheld sentence 4 years probation, court costs, $250.00 DNA surcharge & sample. No credit. Def. is eligible for Earn Release & Challenge Program.  Def. advised of firearm and voting rights.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Def. advised of postconviction rights.  Atty Laufenberg needs to get final bill in.  If refund poster would request to apply to court costs.  Court will suspend payments.
Ad Prosequendum and Order to Institution
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 9:08 am.  Atty Laufenberg have reached an offer. State will complete Writ.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Lindsay L. Hodges in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Defendant Lindsay L. Hodges in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 14CF104  @ 9:58 a.m. Court has reviewed amended revocation summary. Arguments by D.A. Recommends on ct 1 - 3 yrs prison, 1 yr initial, 2 yrs ext supv. conditions as set forth by DOC. On ct 3 -  6 yrs, 3 yrs initial, 3 yrs ext supv., concurrent to ct 1. Civil judgment for outstanding court obligations and credit for time served - Atty Laufenberg may have total figured. No additions or corrections to packet by either Counsel. Arguments by Atty Laufenberg. Asks Court to follow Dept's recommendation, and 286 days credit. Statement by Defendant. Sentencing remarks by the Court. Orders on ct 1 -  1 yr initial confinement,  2 yrs ext supv. Convert outstanding court obligations to civil judgment. Conditions as determined by DOC. Ct 3 - 4 yrs prison, 2 yrs initial, 2 yrs ext supv. concurrent to ct 1. Convert oustanding court obligations to civil judgment. Credit for 286 days served (both cts). Postconviction rights. Def eligible for substance abuse program and challenge incarceration program. Def advised of firearms and voting restrictions.  15CF136 called @ 10:31 a.m. Same appearances. Status conference set for 4/26/16 @ 9:00 a.m.

Defendant Lindsay L. Hodges in court, in custody with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 3:34 pm.  If parties know that it is going to trial need to schedule with JA before next date, Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Lindsay L. Hodges in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 10:07 am.  Waiver of Preliminary Examination Filed.  Atty Laufenberg was p.h.   Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver. Information Filed.  Atty Laufenberg has copy of information, waives reading, reserve all rights & enters Not Guilty plea. Court accepts waiver of reading & enters Not Guilty plea to all 4 ct's.  Status conference scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Lindsay L. Hodges in court via video with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Defendant Lindsay L. Hodges in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 11:26 a.m. Copy of complaint received, reading waived. Prelim requested. Court explains time limits to Def. Def waives time limits. Court accepts as voluntary. Bond remains.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.
for Appointment of An Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency and Order

Defendant Lindsay L. Hodges in court, via video, in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews file.  Def has applied for court appointed atty.  Court is searching for an atty.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lindsay L. Hodges in court via video, in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Called at 1:48 pm  Court reviews file.  Def has completed a petition for court appointed atty.  Def is requesting a court appointed atty., and will for go public defender.  Court reviews petition for court appointed atty.  Court will approve petition.  Court will order $100. per month commencing 11-1-15 and def to post $200.00 retainer fee.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lindsay L. Hodges in court, via video , in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews file and status of an atty.  Atty Schuster, public defender gives statement.  Def indicates that she has completed a court appointed form.  Court questions def in regards to paper work for public defender.  Def is requesting court appointed atty.  Judge checks with JA in regards to paper work for court appt.   Def is still on probation hold.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lindsay L. Hodges in court, via video, in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information is still needed for public defender to be appointed.  Request 2 week adjournment.  Def is still on probation hold.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lindsay L. Hodges in court, via video, in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Schuster in regards to appointing counsel for def.  Court advises def what is needed for public defender to be appointed.  Bond will continue  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lindsay L. Hodges in court, via video, in custody.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cash bond of $500.00 has been posted.  Def is on probation hold.  Def has not contacted an atty yet, attempted.   Court will adjourn this matter for  def to contact an atty.  Poster of bond request bond be returned.  Court will authorize clerk to return cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
